snippet: Buying an individual company’s stock is a wager on an unknowable future, as Facebook investors will tell you, and it can take decades before you know if you have a winner.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column contends that Facebook's unruly initial public offering, and the subsequent decline in its stock price, underlines how difficult it is for individual investors to profitably pick stocks; argues that in most cases it can take decades of sustained investment in single entities before such bets pay off.
lead_paragraph: Buying an individual company’s stock is a wager on an unknowable future, as Facebook investors will tell you, and it can take decades before you know if you have a winner.

headline.seo: How to Pick Stocks After Facebook’s I.P.O.
